titles.title: First Higher Education Extension Act of 2007
First Higher Education Extension Act of 2007
To temporarily extend the programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Mr. Hinojosa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2559.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
Star Print ordered on the bill.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Higher Education, Lifelong Learning, and Competitiveness.

bill.summary: 6/6/2007--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) First Higher Education Extension Act of 2007 - Amends the Higher Education Extension Act of 2005 to extend the programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965 through October 31, 2007.
